lettings.migrations¶

lettings.migrations.0001_initialize_and_transfer_data module¶

class lettings.migrations.0001_initialize_and_transfer_data.Migration(name, app_label)¶

Bases: Migration

This migration creates the Address and Letting models in the ‘lettings’ app, then runs a data transfer operation to move existing data from the old models in ‘oc_lettings_site’ to the newly created models.

Attributes:

initial (bool): Indicates whether this is an initial migration. dependencies (list): Specifies the migration dependencies.

This migration depends on the initial migration of the ‘oc_lettings_site’ app.

operations (list): A list of operations to be performed in this migration.

This includes creating the new models and running the transfer_data function to move the data.

dependencies = [('oc_lettings_site', '0001_initial')]¶
initial = True¶
operations = [<CreateModel  name='Address', fields=[('id', <django.db.models.fields.AutoField>), ('number', <django.db.models.fields.PositiveIntegerField>), ('street', <django.db.models.fields.CharField>), ('city', <django.db.models.fields.CharField>), ('state', <django.db.models.fields.CharField>), ('zip_code', <django.db.models.fields.PositiveIntegerField>), ('country_iso_code', <django.db.models.fields.CharField>)]>, <CreateModel  name='Letting', fields=[('id', <django.db.models.fields.AutoField>), ('title', <django.db.models.fields.CharField>), ('address', <django.db.models.fields.related.OneToOneField>)]>, <RunPython <function transfer_data>>]¶
lettings.migrations.0001_initialize_and_transfer_data.transfer_data(apps, schema_editor) → None¶

This function is intended to be used in a Django migration to transfer Address and Letting data from the old models in the oc_lettings_site app to the new models in the lettings app.

Args:

apps (Apps): An instance that gives access to the historical versions of models. schema_editor (SchemaEditor): The database schema editor responsible

for applying the migration.

Returns:

None
